page.title: 19WAR-TIME KEMBERTON
page.content: Butchers also made meat deliveries from the back of a van. Another van sold hardware items. About 3 bakeries supplied bread. Milk was delivered in bottles but extra supplies could be obtained from the local farms. Most people grew their own vegetables. During the war extra plots were dug to grow food. Rabbit,hare,pigeon,pheasant and trout supplemented rations. Some people came to Kemberton to escape from more dangerous areas. Lady Hatherton and her son lived at The Cedars for a few years. American soldiers were based near the village. Other new arrivals were landarmy girl and German and Italian prisoners of war.Proceeds from Concerts and other activities, held in the village hall, went to a Troop Fund for returning soldiers.The activities of an airfield near the village were kept secret.
